intro: Lagotis globosa, commonly known as the globe bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its globular, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a velvety texture. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a showy display of blue or purple hues.
